column4: anyone have any idea how to force ubuntu server to use an external DNS for resolving a domain name?
well my in house DNS has an issue resolving this address interally, djveer , i want to point it to an external
u should do that in router configuration
do you have access to externl DNS queries ?
try to query with dig
dig@remoteserver yahoo.com
dig @remote name
shows as Internet A record on dyndys
do you see an aswer section there and an IP ?
i show quesiton section authority section, says got ansswer, no error, recursion requested but not avail
try to query another server something form opendns eg
yes, i get positive results from another name server as well
it is possible in some server configs not to have a name.com answer but only www.name.com

my house dns is windows serv 2k3, i believe. i show an A record but it only points to my 2 in house dns' for that domain without the www. sub in front. do you know if it's possible to add a third extrenal name server to that without messing up the house dns records?\
if you are getting a negative response u have nothing to do, if the server times out it will hit your 32rd and 3rd line in toyr resolv.conf
can i add the external nameserver to either resolv.conf or my in house windows dns?
when i added the nameserver to my resolv.conf file, it does not stay put, it reverts after reboot
you can add it in both locations if you want but better add it to your resolv.conf
i've added to resolv.conf but it does not save changes after reboot
can u add it to naetwork manager configuration ?
not sure, running in CLI mode only for server
i have been putting in on the 5th or 6th line down. does it ned to be on the third?
